meanings.definition: The process of separating into layers.
meanings.sent1: The delamination of the old paint revealed multiple colors underneath.
meanings.sent2: The delamination of the sandwich caused the layers to fall apart.
meanings.sent3: The delamination of the cake layers made it look like a tasty rainbow.
meanings.sent4: The delamination of the rock formations exposed the different geological eras.
meanings.sent5: The delamination of the paper made it easier to create a collage.

meanings.definition: The act of splitting or peeling apart.
meanings.sent1: Careful handling is necessary to prevent the delamination of the fragile document.
meanings.sent2: The delamination of the sticker from the surface left a sticky residue.
meanings.sent3: The delamination of the banana peel surprised the monkey at the zoo.
meanings.sent4: The delamination of the old wallpaper revealed a hidden message.
meanings.sent5: The delamination of the scotch tape made it difficult to stick things together.

meanings.definition: The state of being divided into thin layers.
meanings.sent1: The delamination of the plywood made it easier to bend.
meanings.sent2: The delamination of the ice sheet created a fragile surface to walk on.
meanings.sent3: The delamination of the pastry layers made the dessert look fancy.
meanings.sent4: The delamination of the onion skin revealed its delicate layers.
meanings.sent5: The delamination of the fabric showed its intricate weaving pattern.
